1.name: Investigation by Assigned Investigators
1.message: First 10 Days: Upon receiving information about a cognizable offense, the police initiate an investigation. A preliminary inquiry may be conducted within 14 days to ascertain whether a prima facie case exists.

2.name: Arrest and Bail (Jamin) Proceedings
2.message: 11th–14th Day: If investigation reveals sufficient grounds, accused may be arrested and produced before Magistrate within 24 hours. Max police custody is 15 days. 60 days is charge sheet filing limit.

3.name: Crime Investigation with Senior PI
3.message: 15th–19th Day: Investigation continues under supervision of Senior PI. IO collects evidence, records statements, and prepares case diary.

4.name: Report Submission to ACP
4.message: 20th–24th Day: IO submits progress report to ACP. ACP reviews investigation and may provide further directions.

5.name: Finalization of Investigation
5.message: 25th–27th Day: IO finalizes investigation, prepares charge sheet, and submits to Magistrate. If not completed within 60 days, accused may be released on bail.

6.name: Court Verification
6.message: 28th–29th Day: Charge sheet presented in appropriate court (Taluka/District). Court verifies charge sheet and may issue summons/warrants.

7.name: Submission of Crime to Court
7.message: 30th Day: Case formally submitted to court for trial. Court schedules hearings and trial proceeds.

1.name: Investigation by Assigned Investigators
1.message: First 20 Days: Police initiate investigation. Preliminary inquiry matching major offense protocols.

2.name: Arrest and Bail (Jamin) Proceedings
2.message: 21st–30th Day: Arrest proceedings. Accused produced before Magistrate within 24 hours. Max police custody 15 days.

3.name: Crime Investigation with Senior PI
3.message: 31st–35th Day: Investigation continues under Senior PI supervision. Evidence collection and case diary preparation.

4.name: Report Submission to ACP
4.message: 35th–40th Day: IO submits progress report to ACP for review and directions.

5.name: Finalization of Investigation
5.message: 41st–50th Day: Finalize investigation, prepare charge sheet. 60/90 day filing limit check.

6.name: Court Verification
6.message: 51st–55th Day: Charge sheet presented in Taluka/District Court for verification and issuance of summons.

7.name: Submission of Crime to Court
7.message: 56th–60th Day: Formal submission to court for trial scheduling.
